title: Easy violin plots — nice_violin
code: nice_violin(   data,   group,   response,   boot = TRUE,   bootstraps = 2000,   colours,   xlabels = NULL,   ytitle = ggplot2::waiver(),   xtitle = NULL,   has.ylabels = TRUE,   has.xlabels = TRUE,   comp1 = 1,   comp2 = 2,   signif_annotation = NULL,   signif_yposition = NULL,   signif_xmin = NULL,   signif_xmax = NULL,   ymin,   ymax,   yby = 1,   CIcap.width = 0.1,   obs = FALSE,   alpha = 1,   border.colour = "black",   border.size = 2,   has.d = FALSE,   d.x = mean(c(comp1, comp2)) * 1.1,   d.y = mean(data[[response]]) * 1.3 )

title: Easy violin plots — nice_violin
text: data data frame. group group plot variable. response dependent variable plotted. boot Logical, whether use bootstrapping . bootstraps many bootstraps use. colours Desired colours plot, desired. xlabels individual group labels x-axis. ytitle optional y-axis label, desired. xtitle optional x-axis label, desired. .ylabels Logical, whether x-axis labels . .xlabels Logical, whether y-axis labels . comp1 first unit pairwise comparison, goal compare two groups. Automatically displays *, **, *** depending significance difference. Can take either numeric value (based group number) name group directly. Must provided along argument comp2. comp2 second unit pairwise comparison, goal compare two groups. Automatically displays "", "", "" depending significance difference. Can take either numeric value (based group number) name group directly. Must provided along argument comp1. signif_annotation Manually provide required annotations/numbers stars (character strings). Useful automatic pairwise comparison annotation work expected, yet one wants one pairwise comparison. Must provided along arguments signif_yposition, signif_xmin, signif_xmax. signif_yposition Manually provide vertical position annotations/stars, based y-scale. signif_xmin Manually provide first part horizontal position annotations/stars (start left-sided bracket), based x-scale. signif_xmax Manually provide second part horizontal position annotations/stars (end right-sided bracket), based x-scale. ymin minimum score y-axis scale. ymax maximum score y-axis scale. yby much increase "tick" y-axis scale. CIcap.width width confidence interval cap. obs Logical, whether plot individual observations . alpha transparency plot. border.colour colour violins border. border.size size violins border. .d Whether display d-value. d.x x-axis coordinates d-value. d.y y-axis coordinates d-value.

title: Easy violin plots — nice_violin
code: # Make the basic plot nice_violin(   data = ToothGrowth,   group = "dose",   response = "len" )   if (FALSE) { # Save a high-resolution image file to specified directory ggsave("niceviolinplothere.pdf",   width = 7, height = 7, unit = "in",   dpi = 300, path = "/" ) # change for your own desired path }  # Change x- and y- axes labels nice_violin(   data = ToothGrowth,   group = "dose",   response = "len",   ytitle = "Length of Tooth",   xtitle = "Vitamin C Dosage" )   # See difference between two groups nice_violin(   data = ToothGrowth,   group = "dose",   response = "len",   comp1 = "0.5",   comp2 = "2" )   nice_violin(   data = ToothGrowth,   group = "dose",   response = "len",   comp1 = 2,   comp2 = 3 )   # Compare all three groups nice_violin(   data = ToothGrowth,   group = "dose",   response = "len",   signif_annotation = c("*", "**", "***"),   # manually enter the number of stars   signif_yposition = c(30, 35, 40),   # What height (y) should the stars appear   signif_xmin = c(1, 2, 1),   # Where should the left-sided brackets start (x)   signif_xmax = c(2, 3, 3) )  # Where should the right-sided brackets end (x)  # Set the colours manually nice_violin(   data = ToothGrowth,   group = "dose",   response = "len",   colours = c("darkseagreen", "cadetblue", "darkslateblue") )   # Changing the names of the x-axis labels nice_violin(   data = ToothGrowth,   group = "dose",   response = "len",   xlabels = c("Low", "Medium", "High") )   # Removing the x-axis or y-axis titles nice_violin(   data = ToothGrowth,   group = "dose",   response = "len",   ytitle = NULL,   xtitle = NULL )   # Removing the x-axis or y-axis labels (for whatever purpose) nice_violin(   data = ToothGrowth,   group = "dose",   response = "len",   has.ylabels = FALSE,   has.xlabels = FALSE )   # Set y-scale manually nice_violin(   data = ToothGrowth,   group = "dose",   response = "len",   ymin = 5,   ymax = 35,   yby = 5 ) #> Warning: Removed 1 rows containing non-finite values (stat_ydensity).   # Plotting individual observations nice_violin(   data = ToothGrowth,   group = "dose",   response = "len",   obs = TRUE ) #> Bin width defaults to 1/30 of the range of the data. Pick better value with `binwidth`.   # Micro-customizations nice_violin(   data = ToothGrowth,   group = "dose",   response = "len",   CIcap.width = 0,   alpha = .70,   border.size = 1,   border.colour = "white",   comp1 = 1,   comp2 = 2,   has.d = TRUE )

text: formula formula indicating measurement variable grouping variables. e.g. y ~ x1 + x2. data data frame use. var measurement variable use. name double quotes. group grouping variable use. name double quotes. Multiple names listed vector. (See example.) trim proportion observations trimmed end values mean calculated. (mean()) na.rm TRUE, NA values removed calculations. (mean()) conf confidence interval use. R number bootstrap replicates use bootstrapped statistics. boot TRUE, includes mean bootstrapped means. can used estimate mean group. traditional TRUE, includes traditional confidence intervals group means, using t-distribution. trim 0, traditional confidence interval produce NA. Likewise, NA values removed, traditional confidence interval produce NA. normal TRUE, includes normal confidence intervals group means bootstrap. See boot.ci. basic TRUE, includes basic confidence intervals group means bootstrap. See boot.ci. percentile TRUE, includes percentile confidence intervals group means bootstrap. See boot.ci. bca TRUE, includes BCa confidence intervals group means bootstrap. See boot.ci. digits number significant figures use output. ... arguments passed boot function.

title: Get group means and CIs (rcompanion::groupwiseMean) — rcompanion_groupwiseMean
text: input include either formula data; data, var, group. (See examples).
code: Results for ungrouped (one-sample) data can be obtained by either      setting the right side of the formula to 1, e.g.  y ~ 1, or by      setting \code{group=NULL} when using \code{var}.

title: Get group means and CIs (rcompanion::groupwiseMean) — rcompanion_groupwiseMean
text: parsing formula simplistic. first variable left side used measurement variable.  variables right side used grouping variables.
code: In general, it is advisable to handle \code{NA} values before      using this function.      With some options, the function may not handle missing values well,      or in the manner desired by the user.      In particular, if \code{bca=TRUE} and there are \code{NA} values,      the function may fail.       For a traditional method to calculate confidence intervals      on trimmed means,      see Rand Wilcox, Introduction to Robust Estimation and      Hypothesis Testing.

what: Standardize based on the absolute median deviation — scale_mad
title: Standardize based on the absolute median deviation — scale_mad
text: Scale center ("standardize") data based median absolute deviation. See: Leys, C., Ley, C., Klein, O., Bernard, P., & Licata, L. (2013). Detecting outliers: use standard deviation around mean, use absolute deviation around median. Journal Experimental Social Psychology, 49(4), 764–766. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jesp.2013.03.013
